we need to be mindful of

1138.10.text:
is not allowing the
complexity of the housing

1141.61.text:
debate and the homeless
debate to be driven by the

1145.81.text:
cover of newspapers. With all
due respect to newspapers.

1148.78.text:
And we cannot allow it to become
an us versus them scenario.

1153.85.text:
That's not going to
solve the problem.

1155.96.text:
All that's going to
do is rip us apart.

1159.16.text:
Now does solving this
problem mean that some

1162.06.text:
people are going to
have to sacrifice,

1164.06.text:
that developers might
get less tax breaks? Yes.

1166.33.text:
That neighborhoods may
get supportive housing or

1168.70.text:
shelter that
they don't want? Yes.

1170.77.text:
But that's part of what we've
always done as New Yorkers.

1173.97.text:
Is come together to fix
things and you don't get

1176.91.text:
the right to complain
about the person on your

1178.91.text:
corner unless you're going
to step forward and find a

1183.55.text:
And I really think that's
what New Yorkers want to do.

1186.32.text:
I got to tell you at
WIN we have volunteers,

1188.99.text:
we have almost five
hundred volunteers and

1193.03.text:
We have a woman who makes
hundreds of stockings

1196.20.text:
filled with treats
and brings them to our shelter.

1199.27.text:
She just makes them
around her kitchen table,

1201.70.text:
which is probably this big
because she lives in Manhattan.

1204.47.text:
You know so we can do
it we just have to stop

1208.31.text:
allowing the debate to be
driven by finger pointing.

1212.85.text:
the shelter population,
every night is somewhere

1215.75.text:
between fifty and
sixty thousand people,

1220.42.text:

thousand of them are children.

1224.89.text:
But that actually
understates the problem

1227.69.text:
doesn't it because you
have families who are

1230.10.text:
doubled up and tripled up.
Talk about that a little bit.

>>>CHRISTINE QUINN:
Absolutely I mean you know

1235.17.text:
the numbers obviously the

1237.24.text:

1239.24.text:

1242.88.text:

1249.35.text:

1255.15.text:
term for a
host of reasons.

1257.06.text:
And actually what we see
in our data is that the

1260.19.text:

shelter and go back to

1263.36.text:
what we call family

1266.10.text:
their family are most

1270.54.text:
because it didn't work and

1273.61.text:

1277.11.text:

1282.55.text:
shadow of a doubt that
we're not inadvertently

1284.82.text:

into an abusive situation.

1287.75.text:
Because you know Bob, one

1290.32.text:

1293.16.text:
happens like it does on Law

1295.43.text:
I mean that somebody beats

1298.03.text:
That's not how it happens in

1302.40.text:
the women at WIN are survivors

1305.97.text:
But single digits

1310.78.text:
>>>CHRISTINE QUINN: Huge
and I bet most providers

1312.78.text:

would say the same thing

1316.45.text:
but they don't
come in and say that. Why?

1319.49.text:
They don't necessarily

1323.89.text:
They've said it before and
nobody helped them or they

1326.33.text:
don't even know that it's

1330.46.text:
And that's important for

1337.54.text:

who are domestic violence

1340.47.text:
